org.typemeta.funcj.control

Interface Reader<A,R>


  • public interface Reader<A,R>
    Reader is an implementation of the Reader monad. Reader is essentially an enriched Functions.F.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Reader.Kleisli<T,U,V>
      Kleisli models composable operations that return a Reader.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default <T> Reader<A,T> andThen(Reader<? super R,? extends T> f)
      Compose this Reader with another, to create a Reader that first applies this Reader and then applies f to the result.

      Applicative function application.
      default <B> Reader<A,B> app(Reader<A,Functions.F<R,B>> rf)
      Applicative Reader composition.

      Apply this function

    • Method Detail

      • pure

        static <A,R> Reader<A,R> pure(R r)
        A Reader that always returns the same value, regardless of its argument
        Type Parameters:
        A - the input type of the Reader
        R - the type of the constant value r
        Parameters:
        r - the value the Reader will return
        Returns:
        the constant Reader

      • ask

        static <T> Functions.F<T,T> ask()

      • ap

        static <A,T,U> Reader<A,U> ap(Reader<A,Functions.F<T,U>> rf,
                              Reader<A,T> rt)
        Applicative function application.
        Type Parameters:
        A - the function argument type
        T - the function input type
        U - the function return type
        Parameters:
        rf - the function wrapped in a Reader
        rt - the function argument wrapped in a Reader
        Returns:
        the result of applying the function to the argument, wrapped in a Try

      • traverse

        static <T,A,B> Reader<T,IList<B>> traverse(IList<A> la,
                                           Functions.F<A,Reader<T,B>> ffb)
        Standard applicative traversal.

        Equivalent to 

        sequence(lt.map(f))
        .
        Type Parameters:
        T - the input type of the applicative function
        A - the type of list elements
        B - the return type of the F returned by the function
        Parameters:
        la - the list of values
        ffb - the function to be applied to each value in the list
        Returns:
        an F which wraps an IList of values

      • sequence

        static <T,U> Reader<T,IList<U>> sequence(IList<Reader<T,U>> lfu)
        Standard applicative sequencing.

        Translate a IList of Fs into a F of an IList, by composing each consecutive Fs using the F#app(F) method.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the input type of the applicative function
        U - the return type of the Fs in the list
        Parameters:
        lfu - the list of F values
        Returns:
        a Reader which wraps an IList of values

      • sequence

        static <T,U> Reader<T,Stream<U>> sequence(Stream<Reader<T,U>> sfu)
        Variation of sequence(IList) for Stream.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the error type
        U - the return type of the Fs in the stream
        Parameters:
        sfu - the stream of F values
        Returns:
        a F which wraps an Stream of values

      • apply

        R apply(A a)
        Apply this function
        Parameters:
        a - the function argument
        Returns:
        the result of applying this function

      • compose

        default <T> Reader<T,R> compose(Reader<? super T,? extends A> f)
        Compose this Reader with another, to create a Reader that first applies f and then applies this Reader to the result.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the argument type to f
        Parameters:
        f - the Reader to compose with
        Returns:
        a Reader that first applies f and then applies this to the result.

      • andThen

        default <T> Reader<A,T> andThen(Reader<? super R,? extends T> f)
        Compose this Reader with another, to create a Reader that first applies this Reader and then applies f to the result.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the argument type to f
        Parameters:
        f - the function to compose with
        Returns:
        a function that first applies this function and then applies f to the result.

      • map

        default <T> Reader<A,T> map(Functions.F<R,T> f)
        Map a function over this Reader. Essentially compose(org.typemeta.funcj.control.Reader<? super T, ? extends A>) without the wildcard generic types.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the argument type to f
        Parameters:
        f - the function to compose with
        Returns:
        a function that first applies f and then applies this function to the result.

      • app

        default <B> Reader<A,B> app(Reader<A,Functions.F<R,B>> rf)
        Applicative Reader composition.
        Type Parameters:
        B - the return type of the function returned by {code f}
        Parameters:
        rf - the Reader to compose with
        Returns:
        the composed function

      • flatMap

        default <B> Reader<A,B> flatMap(Functions.F<R,Reader<A,B>> f)
        Monadic function composition.
        Type Parameters:
        B - the return type of the function returned by {code f}
        Parameters:
        f - the function to compose with
        Returns:
        the composed function
